meanings.definition: An increase in the severity of a disease or its symptoms.
meanings.sent1: The exacerbation of his cough led to a visit to the doctor.
meanings.sent2: The exacerbation of her fever indicated a worsening condition.
meanings.sent3: The exacerbation of his sneezing made him sound like a trumpet player.
meanings.sent4: The exacerbation of the storm turned the sky into a dark canvas.
meanings.sent5: The exacerbation of the pain felt like a hammer striking his head.

meanings.definition: The act of making a problem, bad situation, or negative feeling worse.
meanings.sent1: Her criticism was an exacerbation of the already tense situation.
meanings.sent2: The exacerbation of his anger only fueled the argument further.
meanings.sent3: His exaggeration of the story was an exacerbation of the truth.
meanings.sent4: The exacerbation of the conflict turned a disagreement into a full-blown fight.
meanings.sent5: The exacerbation of her disappointment felt like a weight on her shoulders.
